clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Two Anatomic Landmarks With Ultrasonography in Spinal Anesthesia
clinical_study.official_title: Phase IV Study of Landmarks for Spinal Anesthesia

lead_sponsor.agency: Diskapi Yildirim Beyazit Education and Research Hospital

clinical_study.source: Diskapi Yildirim Beyazit Education and Research Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: The most used anatomical landmark for application of spinal anesthesia is Tuffier's line. Other alternative landmark is tenth rib. However there is no trial that compare these landmarks based on using ultrasonography.

detailed_description.textblock: The investigators aim to compare two landmarks (Tuffier's line and tenth rib line) for accuracy by using ultrasonography. 40 patients will be included in each groups. all of them will be assessed by ultrasonography during application of spinal anesthesia. And the investigators will examine the percentage of successful estimation of correct vertebral space.

primary_outcome.measure: success of estimation the correct vertebral space
primary_outcome.description: Independently, first anesthesist will determine the spinal anesthesia application point (intervertebral space) according to Tuffier's line and second anesthesist will determine it by ultrasonography. And third anesthesist will compare the accuracy of first determination.

arm_group.description: The intervention is spinal anesthesia. Tenth rib line or Tuffier's line will be examined as application landmarks by ultrasonography for spinal anesthesia.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- knee arthroscopic surgery
Exclusion Criteria:
- BMI>30
- anatomical anomaly of vertebrae

reference.citation: Jung CW, Bahk JH, Lee JH, Lim YJ. The tenth rib line as a new landmark of the lumbar vertebral level during spinal block. Anaesthesia. 2004 Apr;59(4):359-63.
